column4: Hi all...total noob here with a question - how do I totally remove a program (firefox) from my system if it is not flagged as installed in the Synaptics Package list?
if you uninstalled it through synaptic, it should be uninstalled.
it's still installed as v2.0.0.4
thats odd. which version of ubuntu are you running?
I am running 8.10
the 32bit version
it was an upgrade from version 6 up
could run this command: cat /etc/apt/sources.list and put the results in pastebin?
is there a specific lib I should run this in?
lib? just run it an a terminal
I just ran it and it said no such file or directory
thats very odd. Can you pastebin the results of ls /etc/apt ?
not very good at this, so how do I "pastebin"?
go to paste.ubuntu.com and paste the link here
did it
well I need the link
http://paste.ubuntu.com/154279/
is that it?
ah, I see the problem. its /etc/apt/sources.list, not sources.lst
ooops sorry
http://paste.ubuntu.com/154281/
still with me?
